Global Company - Strong Career Opportunity

Civil Engineer or Building Engineer, passionate about contributing to change in the building industry? Looking for a role with variety where you will make a difference? Want to work with a diverse range of stakeholder across the company and across industry?

This global manufacturer has operations in Australia, Asia, Europe and North America and the role is instrumental in their drive to continuously improve their competitive position. They invent, manufacture and market specialist building products.

Reporting to the Regional Engineering Manager and working in a small team of professional engineers you will provide value added advice to Architects, Builders, Distributors, Sales, the Customer Services Team and other internal stakeholders on the use of the company's products. You will do this in an office based environment and by spending time on site.

This role will allow you to identify issues and opportunities that impact end users and then to work with Product Development and R&D to enhance product performance and be involved in managing product claims.

You are articulate, energetic and inquisitive in understanding the building industry and its use of various materials in terms of practicality, design, cost and sustainability. You possess an honours degree in Engineering or Architecture; you may have a Fa\xe7ade Design, Structural, Civil or Construction background and a passion for change in the building industry.

If successful you will be provided with a thorough induction and on going technical/product training and professional development. This role will require sporadic travel in Australia and possibly overseas. The company rewards initiative, creativity and results within a highly collegiate professional environment.

Interested? Call Garry King on 02 8912 9888 for more information or apply Ref No. 23837.



Desired Skills and Experience

You are articulate, energetic and inquisitive in understanding the building industry and its use of various materials in terms of practicality, design, cost and sustainability. The successful candidate will have solid Project Management experience in the real estate industry, preferably client side/consultancy, highly organised, tenacious, commercially aware and deadline-driven.


This fast-paced Project Management role will allow you to collaborate with other divisions within the business, which will give our clients a holistic service. We are seeking an enthusiastic team player who is keen to join a successful and growing Project Management team.


The Role:

  • Provide a range of project management services to deliver capex and workspace projects
  • Procurement of project teams, including design consultants, certifiers and others
  • Design management
  • Cost and budget development and management

About Uniting

At Uniting we are passionate about working together to inspire people, enliven communities and confront injustice.

Senior Marketing Manager – Content Planning

Company Name The Walt Disney Company Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 3 hours ago Number of views 28 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Summary

The Senior Manager - Content Planning will lead the overarching content marketing strategy for The Walt Disney Company ANZ and will focus on content and distribution planning in partnership with line of business marketing teams including Studios, Disney Consumer Products, Disney Channels and Franchise. The role will manage the Content Planning team comprising of media and performance marketing disciplines and work in collaboration with other team members focused on Consumer Insights, Creative and Content Services. The role will guide and advise the marketing teams within each business area in the best use of our owned media assets and most effective combination of Owned, Earned Shared and Paid media for each campaign. The Senior Manager – Content Planning will be responsible for leading a team to develop and execute the appropriate content strategy, developing content ideas and calendars, working collaboratively with business areas on the most effective content, creative formats and distribution plan for their marketing campaigns.

Responsibilities

Content Planning - Strategy
  • Develop content strategy for TWDC ANZ to ensure that we have the most effective combination of owned, earned, shared and paid (OESP) assets to engage our consumers.
  • In partnership with the broader Content & Consumer Engagement team, ensure that we are future proofed by recommending a strategic direction for our owned ecosystem, ensuring that we invest into the correct platforms for the future.
  • Drive innovation in both maximising the use of existing owned assets and the creation of new owned assets as required.
  • Create an environment that fosters and encourages creative thinking from the marketing teams.
  • Drive innovation agenda across OESP content planning.
  • Oversee content planning for all TWDC ANZ marketing campaigns, ensuring the most effective combination of OESP channels for each campaign to ensure AOP targets are met.
  • Ensure agency partners are fully briefed on our strategic direction and are equipped to make valuable contributions to our objectives.
  • Stay up to date with the latest developments in marketing and media to ensure that TWDC are first to market with latest technologies and trends.
  • Partner with Content Services and Digital teams to ensure smooth execution of campaign needs.
Team & People
  • Manage a team of eight team members (4 direct reports and 4 indirect reports), providing coaching, mentoring, and development planning to support personal and professional development over the longer-term.
  • Develop processes and approaches to encourage a culture of collaboration and open communication.
  • Motivate and develop team to deliver against the annual business plans, setting challenging objectives and supporting them to deliver stretch performance targets.
  • Lead communication with the Global Media and Sourcing team and create conversation to raise local needs, media efficiencies, sharing information, results and best practice.
  • Constantly communicate with the key stakeholders to develop grounded broad commercial opinion.
  • Excite and drive understanding of Content Planning across the wider TWDC
  • Lead the management of the relationship with the media agency
  • Work with the Social Media team on developing effective social media ideas and executions to support content planning campaign deliveries
  • With guidance from the Director - Content Planning, organise an annual offsite day with a focus on forward planning
    • Financial
    • Contribute, alongside Finance & LOB marketing teams to budget forecasts/setting and title P&L’s.
    • In collaboration with the business area manage content marketing budgets for each campaign releases, driving maximum revenue and efficiency for TWDC.
    • Work closely with Marketing team to develop a robust budget to effectively maximise our internal resources and drive OESP strategic thinking.
    • Manage ongoing agency review process – performance and media buying, including leading discussions with the media agency on annual media deals on behalf of TWDC ANZ.
    • Manage Media Agency PRIP process (where applicable)
    Insights & Reporting
    • Lead the Performance Marketing team in delivering appropriate owned, earned, shared & paid measurement tools, approaches and reporting.
    • Manage agency planning process, ensuring dissemination of key insights and actions to the leadership team and broader marketing community.
    • Use insights to drive intelligence for title marketing campaigns and post campaigns reviews
    • Provide essential insight & knowledge for the Senior Management Team.

    Basic Qualifications
    • Significant marketing experience (10+ years)
    • Demonstrated experience in managing/working with media agencies (7+ years)
    • Demonstrated experience of paid media principles across all channels
    • Demonstrable experience of developing and implementing marketing strategies and successfully influencing others as part of this. Solid Leadership qualities and experience
    • Proven ability to develop clear marketing strategy using strategic analysis and frameworks, and effectively communicating and gaining buy-in on developed strategy.
    • Proven identification, development and delivery of significant innovative and value-add initiatives to the business.
    • Solid experience in initiating and advocating cross-functional and cross-business projects, including assembling resources, defining project plan and key deliverables, obtaining buy-in and driving projects to successful completion.
    • Solid experience in online social marketing and digital.
    • Proven ability in budget management and cost control.
    • Communication and engagement with top-level management.
    • Cross-functional/cross-business team engagement and matrix environment working and reporting.

    Preferred Qualifications
    • Solid experience with, and knowledge of, new technology trends and new content distribution technologies and platforms.
    • Working and dealing with a corporate environment across multiple locations
    Required Education
    • Bachelor Degree in Marketing or related discipline

    Additional Information
    • 12 month Fixed Term Contract

    About Walt Disney International

    Working directly with amazing brands, you and your team will touch lives around the world. Get ready to be creative, work with advanced technology and grow your skills with a pioneer in entertainment and technology. Join us, and be part of the story.

    About The Walt Disney Company

    The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

    This position is with The Walt Disney Company (Australia) Pty Ltd, which is part of a business segment we call Walt Disney International.

    Job ID 597131BR

Business Development Consultant - Full Time Fixed Term

Company Name EACH Company Location Boronia, AU

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

Use your success in business development to engage customers to access NDIS services through EACH.
  • Full Time Position
  • Eastern Suburbs (Knox Area) Location
  • Not-for-profit Organisation

About The Role

As a Business Development Consultant you will be responsible for building strong relationships with new and transitioning NDIS customers, community services, networks and other organisations. The Business Development Consultant is the key contact for engaging customers to assist them receive the services they wish to access through EACH. This role reports into the local Area Manager.

About You

This position would suit someone with a strong marketing capability. The successful candidate must be customer-focused with a high level of motivation and enthusiasm to maintain a positive reputation of EACH in the wider community. The Business Development Consultant ensures all promotional activity, marketing and customer service strategies for their region are implemented, monitored and reviewed to ensure accountability and positioning of EACH within the region as a major provider of commercialised services.

The successful candidate must be capable to work to achieving set targets and KPIs. This position is responsible for generating $1.8-$2.0 million for new NDIS business in the relevant region. This will require strong collaboration with EACH Service Delivery to ensure customer needs can be met.

The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of the NDIS, including the underpinning NDIS Framework and Funding Model. The successful candidate will have experience working to achieve KPIs with a demonstrated ability to monitor progress and prepare reports.

Candidates also need to show a commitment to professional and ethical conduct and the values of the organisation

Why You Should Apply?
  • Join a vibrant and innovative not for profit organisation committed to an integrated approach to service, and help make a positive difference in the lives of over forty thousand people each year.
  • Values and the way we interact with each other and our customers are extremely important to us. We Care, We Listen, We Engage, We Deliver.
  • We strive to provide seamless coordinated care. Whilst we are not there yet, we are constantly working on our processes with a commitment to service, advocacy and innovation to achieve this.
  • We are situated within the community and in most cases close to major shopping precincts
  • We offer a family friendly workplace
  • Not For Profit Salary Packaging Available

About EACH

A contemporary not-for-profit EACH provides a range of health disability, counselling and mental health services to the community. From humble beginnings established in the Outer East of Melbourne over 44 years ago, committed teams at EACH now consist of over 1300 staff across 65 sites throughout the eastern states of Australia. Together we support over 40 000 clients annually.

At EACH, our vision is for a healthy and inclusive community. Our values promote Customer Centricity, Social Justice, Service Excellence, Innovation and Collaboration - and these underpin the way we work and deliver our services. You can find out more about us here - http://www.each.com.au

We recognise that not everyone experiences life equally. Our focus is about creating opportunities for equitable outcomes. No matter what someone's starting place, we will support them to achieve their goals.

We embrace diversity in all its forms and respect everyone's strength and contributions irrespective of gender, ethnicity, culture, religious beliefs, sexual orientation and political views.

Next Steps?

Applicants are requested to submit a resume and cover letter outlining their suitability for the role.

For specific information about the role, please contact: Debbie Stanley, Area Manager Knox, click apply

Shortlisted Applicants will be contacted by 9 October 2018. Interviews are expected to take place from 11 October 2018.

Vacancy closes 5pm, Tuesday 9 October 2018.

We recognise the benefits that diversity and inclusion brings, and in turn encourage people from all backgrounds, abilities and identities to apply to our vacancies.

Please note that all appointments are subject to one or more of the following forms of pre-employment safety screening checks including; Police Record Check, Working with Children Check, Disability Work Exclusion Scheme Check, Reference Checks and APHRA Registration Check.

Senior Auditor - Assurance & Risk Advisory

Company Name Vincents Company Location Canberra, Australian Capital Territory, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

“Our point of difference is our people; we can’t do what we do without you.” David Rose (Managing Director)

  • Winner of 17 Client Choice Awards since 2008 and nominated again in 2018
  • Regular opportunities to engage with our teams in our other offices (Sydney, Gold Coast and Brisbane)
  • In-house training program and generous postgraduate study support
  • Unique corporate culture created by staff selected values
  • A relaxed, professional working environment where we genuinely enjoy what we do!


It’s an exciting time to join Vincents! We have received an impressive total of 17 Financial Review Client Choice Awards since 2008 and are proud to be finalists in this year’s awards for Best Accounting Firm (Revenue < $50M). \xa0

Examples of awards that we have won in the past include:

  • Best Accounting Firm (Revenue under $50m)
  • Best Queensland Firm
  • Outstanding Client Care


About the Team

Vincents Assurance & Risk Advisory team is experiencing high demand for its services from the government and non-government sectors as it continues to build on its reputation as an outstanding, dynamic and experienced specialist group of professionals.


Commencing in 2012, the unit has quickly gained an excellent reputation for outstanding client care and service consistent with Vincents as a whole. The team is led by highly experienced professionals with backgrounds from Big 4 firms - both internationally and locally. Vincents Assurance & Risk Advisory have become a serious alternative in the market with more clients coming on board every month to access the team’s exceptional skills in the provision of assurance services, including the full range of financial statement and superannuation audits - as well as internal audit and related audit services.


The team’s great success is being built off the back of extremely satisfied customers and a great team of people working together. As a result of this growth, we are looking for a Senior Auditor to join our Assurance & Risk Advisory team in Canberra.


About the Opportunity

This is an exciting time to join our growing Canberra team and use your expertise to provide assurance services to a range of clients in conjunction with the wider Assurance & Risk Advisory Unit. Responsibilities include the provision of financial statement audits as well as internal audits (financial, operational and performance audits).


Duties include:

  • Perform relevant audits in line with the Australian Auditing Standards and the Australian Accounting Standards
  • Plan audit engagements, identify potential audit risks, prepare work plan and coordinate requirements
  • Conduct external audits and undertake internal audit (financial, operational and performance auditing) where required
  • Developing superior technical knowledge to grow your role as ‘expert in the field’
  • Fostering strong client relationships which assist to grow future opportunities


About You

  • Bachelor of Accounting/Commerce or Finance or Business related degree
  • Proven experience in a similar role is essential, external and internal audit experience necessary (minimum 2 years).
  • Completed CA/CPA accreditation
  • Comprehensive knowledge of current external audit concepts and standards
  • Must be eligible to attain a Commonwealth Government Security Clearance


Key Personal Attributes

  • High level of time management
  • Ability to build strong working relationships with clients and internal staff
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work autonomously and in a team
  • Strong attention to detail


An attractive remuneration package consisting of salary and superannuation will be negotiated commensurate with your qualifications and experience.


Our Firm

Vincents is a multi-award winning, full service firm employing 200 people across four offices. Operating in a flat structure, we strongly believe in an open-door policy and two-way communication. Knowledge sharing, personal and professional development are fundamental philosophies of the firm. We are committed to ensuring our employees grow their expertise by investing in a comprehensive in-house training program and generous postgraduate study support. In addition to our education commitments, Vincents believes in providing a holistic work environment that focuses on you as a professional by carving time for your physical well-being through our health and lifestyle benefits.


To find out more about our firm, visit our website www.vincents.com.au


It’s Your Career: Gain Insight, Take Control.


How to Apply

To apply click on the Apply button, submitting your CV and a covering letter detailing your suitability for the role. All applications will be acknowledged by email and treated in the strictest of confidence.


Enquiries to the People and Culture team at recruitment@vincents.com.au


You must be an Australian Citizen or Australian Permanent Resident to apply for this role.

Job description

The Estimator is an essential role within the estimating team which is responsible for providing estimates for the tendering of a wide range of construction projects.\xa0


The Estimator\xa0is responsible for the accurate measurement and pricing of projects, including providing recommendations on materials and engineering processes that can be sourced for the client to improve the construction of the project, and assist in winning tenders


Reporting to the Senior Estimator and/or Estimating Manager, your role and responsibilities will include (but not limited to):


  • Liaising with consulting team as necessary to produce on time/on budget result.
  • Measuring and articulating quantities and values for all anticipated projects
  • Consulting with Project Manager and/or Construction Manager throughout the entire project life-cycle.
  • Price checks against scope of works in conjunction with the project manager
  • Evaluating risk profile against check list


Skills and Experience:

  • 3-6 years post-graduate experience
  • Degree qualification in Quantity Surveying, Engineering or relevant
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Proficency with Microsoft Office, Buildsoft, Aconex, Bluebeam
  • Strong organisational skills and be self-motivated and confident
  • Experience working with Lump Sum and D&C tenders


What we offer:

  • Excellent opportunity to work with a leading residential and commercial builder
  • Down-to-earth office culture and approachable senior team
  • Excellent salary package available (negotiable based on experience)
  • Real opportunities for further growth as seen with our current long-term employees.


We offer you the chance to work for a well-established builder that values hard work, and can provide you with a supportive environment to support creative-thinking, offer career progression and development, as well as a competitive salary package.\xa0

\xa0

If you would like to apply for this opportunity, please submit your CV to Paulo Atienza, Recruitment Coordinator, via the link provided or to paulo.atienza@parkview.com.au


\xa0Please note: agency submissions for this position are NOT being accepted at present.\xa0

We will not be responsible for any unsolicited CV's received.\xa0

Only short listed candidates will be contacted.\xa0

You must have legal rights to work in Australia. \xa0

Senior Business Data Analyst

New Posted Date Posted 17 hours ago Number of views 69 views

Job description

Overview

Intuit is a global fintech company based in Silicon Valley, California. We’re the proud makers of QuickBooks, the world-leading cloud accounting tool for small business. With offices on all continents (except Antarctica), our passionate and high-performing team are dedicated to powering prosperity to over 3.2 million small businesses and self employed around the globe. We are a fantastic place to grow and develop your career. Come join us as a business data analyst who loves to connect the dots and have a true impact!

Responsibilities
  • Handle data extractions from multiple data sources and analyze large volume of data to address key business questions, create/ refine customer segmentations and identify new areas of growth
  • Create reports and dashboards of Leading Indicators that help Business Leaders look for growth opportunities and nip problem areas in the bud quickly
  • Provide Analytics support for campaign measurement planning and post campaign analysis
  • Provide business planners and decision makers with logical data-driven insights translating into hypotheses for Lean Testing and recommendations for quick wins
  • Provide guidance to business forecasting
  • Partner with Marketing, Finance, Central Analytics and cross-functional teams to identify business gaps and opportunities
  • Identify new technical requirements, and test/troubleshoot data capture to ensure reporting and analytics systems conform to data quality standards.
  • Exciting end-to-end customer lifecycle projects include:
  • Growing acquisition channels in Digital (eg: mobile) and Partnership Affiliates
  • Drive customer retention through Product Analytics for stickiness
Qualifications
  • 5 years of experience in analyzing web/media data, digital marketing and product data
  • Strong background in quantitative data analysis, predictive and regression techniques
  • Experience performing A/B testing on very large, multi-dimension datasets
  • Proficient in SQL
  • Strong Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
  • Familiarity with Tableau (Desktop and Server)
  • Familiarity with Web Analytics Tools (eg: Adobe Sitecatalyst) and Media Platforms (eg: AdLens) a plus

Other Requirements
  • Strong business acumen
  • Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) with both technical and non-technical partners
  • Ability to present data insights concisely to various stakeholders, especially business teams
  • Experience working in – or closely with – marketing
  • Entrepreneurial spirit and a passion for data
